docs.snippet: The NBC headquarters is in full Olympics mode, which includes a vastly expanded streaming program that, through Thursday, had offered 1.28 billion minutes of live Rio coverage....
docs.lead_paragraph: The NBC headquarters is in full Olympics mode, which includes a vastly expanded streaming program that, through Thursday, had offered 1.28 billion minutes of live Rio coverage.
docs.abstract: Richard Sandomir TV Sports column examines decision by NBC Sports to live stream every event at 2016 Olympics, which its parent company NBCUniversal considers essential for capturing young viewers that will be its future audience.

headline.main: 1.28 Billion Minutes Streamed (and NBC Is Still Counting)
headline.print_headline: One Network, 1.28 Billion Minutes (and Still Counting)

docs.snippet: Everybody else is catching on to something others have known all along....
docs.lead_paragraph: Everybody else is catching on to something others have known all along.
docs.abstract: Gay community has long loved Olympics; some gay people say it is because Olympics is biggest showcase of individual sports, which many closeted gays participated in during grade school, while others say it is due to artistry often on display; some admit that they watch Olympics because they are attracted to athletes.

headline.main: Q: Why Do Gay Men Love the Olympics? A: Isn’t It Obvious?
